fields.description:
To reproduce:
* Insert a gallery macro onto a page
* select the gallery macro and center align it within the page using the alignment buttons in editor toolbar
* in edit mode the macro will look center aligned.
* save the page and view it

Expected result - the gallery macro output is center aligned
Actual result - the gallery macro output is left-aligned (default)
fields.summary: Cannot center align gallery macro

fields.description:
enabling the macro insert by typing '{' then typing 'erwerwerwerwerwe' and closing the macro '}' will always enable the wiki markup macro. This could be annoying for a user wanting to insert something in curly brackets.

another issue that can be addressed is if a user enters a 'space' after the curly bracket, maybe this could also disable the macro insert function, currently it doesn't)
fields.summary: quick macro insertions autoformat is always displaying Wiki Markup macro when text is not found

fields.description: I have an icon as png and linked to a page, during mouse hover I get the name of the file instead of the tooltip or name of the linked page
fields.summary: No tooltip over images with link on Confluence 4.1
Insert Jira Issue search does not work inside modal

fields.description:
With 2 horizontal rules on top of each other, the editor doesn't behave properly.

See  http://screencast.com/t/bXLigRuzby

Notice how you cannot separate the 2 horizontal rules at all.  Notice that when you hit enter underneath the 2 horizontal rules, the newline appears above them and the cursor appears above them.  So frustrating.

This is with Chrome
fields.summary: horizontal rule bug

fields.description:
Caused by: org.springframework.dao.TransientDataAccessResourceException: StatementCallback; SQL [drop index attch_idver_idx on ATTACHMENTDATA]; For DROP INDEX, you must give both the table and the index name, in the form tablename.indexname.; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: For DROP INDEX, you must give both the table and the index name, in the form tablename.indexname.


Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: For DROP INDEX, you must give both the table and the index name, in the form tablename.indexname.
fields.summary: Upgrade failed because of SQLException: For DROP INDEX you must give both table and the index name

fields.description: The include page macro is not rendering attachments that are listed with the attachments macro in the included page, but are instead displaying attachments from the current page where the include macro is being placed on.  This used to work (in an earlier version).
fields.summary: The attachments macro used in an included page is not displaying attachments from included page, but instead showing attachments from current page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24156].
  {panel}

In most cases Confluence sends e-mails sothat FROM address is the one configured globally as described here: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+a+Server+for+Outgoing+Mail, field "From Address".

In case of mentions, however, it tries to use the e-mail address of the currently authenticated user as the FROM address. It still authenticates to the mail server as the globally configured user. This causes problems in case of Exchange mail server when users are not allowed to send e-mails on behalf of others. In this case Exchange throws "550 5.7.1 Client does not have permissions to send as this sender" error.

The workaround is to configure Exchange so that it allowes to send as any sender as described here: http://www.petri.co.il/forums/showthread.php?p=154834. 

It would, however, be useful to be able to configure the way Confluence handles FROM addresses in case of mentions. It should be possible to send from the globally configured address in the same way all other mails are sent.
fields.summary: Mention e-mails FROM address

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce
# Create an ordered list with parent and child items

E.g.
# Joey's Given names
## Joseph
## Peter

If you attempt to backspace the list point next Joseph (in this case an "a.") the point will outdent rather than deleting the list point
fields.summary: Backspacing a child list item outdent the item on IE

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce
# Create an ordered list with three list items
# Delete the second list item

The numbering gets broken (changes from 1-3 to 1, 1)

[Video|http://screencast.com/t/7RuFH4KDl1pS]

Does not occur on IE9
fields.summary: Ordered list gets broken after user deletes a list item in IE

fields.description:
To Reproduce

1) Fill page with a few lines of text. I.e.:

this
page
has
text

2) click after the word page

3) drag image so cursor is position after the word text (and drop)

4) The image will be pasted after page instead of after text.

In Chrome, the same behaviour is exhibited, however the cursor stays stationary when you are dragging an image into a page.
fields.summary: Firefox appears to ignore the position of the cursor when you drag and drop an image
Quick search should be a sub-set of full search
Edit in office feature not functioning for office 2007 documents

fields.description:
CONF-24038 introduces creation of macros via autoformat when wiki markup macro syntax such as {status:color=green} is typed.  The replacement of the text with the placeholder is buggy though in two big ways:
# There's a delay between the removal of the original text and the replacement with the image placeholder.  As a user, it seems to just disappear, sometimes for quite a long time, and then the placeholder suddenly appears.  It's really offputting.  
# The placeholder once it arrives tends to end up in the wrong place.  I guess it ends up wherever the cursor is at the time the request for it returns.  It really should end up where the original text was though.  At the moment I can often type quite a bit between the initial text disappearing and the placeholder appearing, and the placeholder doesn't end up where it should.
fields.summary: macros inserted by autoformatted are inserted in wrong place and with bad timing
Do not hide the autocomplete box when autocomplete is still happening

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24147].
  {panel}

h4.Description
When using JIRA Issues macro in Confluence, 'number type' fields are rendered differently from JIRA. Instead of showing the value that is displayed in JIRA, it just takes the value straight from the database, and put it in to JIRA Issues macro.  For example: If the number is displaying in JIRA with no decimals, in Confluence it will display a decimal. 

h4.Findings
JIRA is using some vm template to convert the value that is stored in database that makes it easier to be read by end user. However, for JIRA Issues Macro, it doesn't do the same thing, hence, making it difficult to be read by end user.

!issues-macro-1.png|width=400! !issues-macro-2.png|width=400!
\\

!issues-macro-db.png|width=900!
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Macro render number fields differently than in JIRA

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce
# Say if a user has the following bullet list

* Parent 1
** Child 1.1
** Child 1.2
* Parent 2
** Child 2.1
** Child 2.2

# If the user highlights point 2 by placing their cursor on the end of the 2 like so
Parent 2| 
and then hitting Shift+Home to highlight and then Backspace to delete, the entire item (bullet + content) is deleted
That is

* Parent 1
** Child 1.1
** Child 1.2
** Child 2.1
** Child 2.2

I expect the following result 
* Parent 1
** Child 1.1
** Child 1.2
* 
** Child 2.1
** Child 2.2

That is, the bullet point should be retained with the appropriate indentation for the parent point.

This behaviour is demonstrated by FF8

This is also the behaviour when one of the child points will are deleted. That is, if Child 2.1 is deleted, this is the result

* Parent 1
** Child 1.1
** Child 1.2
* Parent 2
** 
** Child 2.2
fields.summary: Deleting parent list item content deletes the parent list item bullet as well in IE

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce
# Create a bullet list like so

* Parent 1
** Child 1.1
** Child 1.2
* Parent 2
** Child 2.1
** Child 2.2

# Attempt to add a new child item or parent item between existing list items

E.g. 

* Parent 1
** Child 1.1
** Child 1.2
* Parent 2
** Child 2.1
**
** Child 2.2

If the user attempts to outdent the new item, it will become stranded and the user will not be able to place the cursor on this point via keyboard or mouse.
fields.summary: New list item gets stranded when outdenting in IE

Personal labels bundled plugin

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24142].
  {panel}

* Info, Tip, Warning and Error are pretty much the same thing with a different coat of paint.
* One way to fix this is by merging all those macros into one (message macro?) and have a parameter that was a select field to to choose the type 'tip', 'info' etc.
* Then we'd add buttons to switch between tips, message, etc and another button to show/hide the icons.
* We should make sure users still get the message macro when they search for "tip" or "warning" etc in autocomplete and the macro browser.

Q: Are people who just want to add a warning macro going to be annoyed that there's now an extra step?
fields.summary: User wants to be able to quickly switch between status, tip, warning and info macros
Make subsections of pages editable

fields.description:
h3. Summary of The Bug

Confluence 4.0 editor in Firefox shows a bug where on table editing where it deletes whole cells instead of just emptying them.

h3. How to Reproduce

# Create a 4x3 table
# Enter some text in the cells
# Highlight the content of three cells on one row
# Delete
# The highlighted cells are deleted instead of just their contents

Refer to this [video|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/56308/2011-12-09_1429.swf] for the detail
fields.summary: Deleting selected table cells corrupts table

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24138].
  {panel}

{noformat}
<ac:link>
  <ri:page ri:content-title="Creating your Technical Documentation Space" />
  <ac:link-body>
    <ac:macro ac:name="screenshot"> <!-- my own macro -->
      <ac:parameter ac:name="align">center</ac:parameter>
      <ac:parameter ac:name="file">documentation_icon.ss</ac:parameter>
    </ac:macro>
  </ac:link-body>
</ac:link>
{noformat}

From a logical point of view, this is valid. I just define a link and its anchor is macro. However, Confluence is not able to render it. "Broken macro" appears instead of the link. Macro itself is not broken, it would render outside of the ac:link.

And no, implementing {{ac:parameter ac:name="link"}} in plugin on my own is not a good idea. Native links have great support in editor - it's possible to browse and point to page, attachment and other resources from current Confluence.

(I am a plugin developer and I work directly on XHTML storage format)
fields.summary: can't make macro become a link

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

When using IE8, if a page contains code macro and image thumbnail, the thumbnail does not enlarge when clicked, instead the screen just remains gray

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Run Confluence on IE8 and create a page
# Insert the code macro into the page
# Insert an image into the page, set it to use thumbnail
# Save the page
# Click on the image to enlarge it

h3. Findings

* I have tried using the fixes mentioned in [CONF-22292|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-22292] but the problem persists
fields.summary: Thumbnails do not enlarge when clicked if using IE8 and code macro
Not able to share page, it throws an error "Error while sending", is it because mails are not configured as we have recently upgraded to version 4

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24133].
  {panel}

h3. Intended behaviour specification

If you have: 

{panel}
# first
# second

third
{panel}

Pressing the numbered bullet list toolbar button or the Ctrl + Shift + B keyboard shortcut at "third" should produce: 

{panel}
# first
# second
# third
{panel}

Similarly if the text is between two numbered lists: 

{panel}
# first
# second

third

# fourth
# fifth
{panel}

We should get: 

{panel}
# first
# second
# third
# fourth
# fifth
{panel}

If there is a nested ordered list preceding the text: 

{panel}
# first
## second

third
{panel}

Then: 

{panel}
# first
## second
## third
{panel}

This behaviour should activate if the cursor is: 
- anywhere among the word "third"
- if the word "third" is wholly selected
fields.summary: Add ability to make text join an existing bullet list

Unable to export images from Word documents as PDF in Confluence

fields.description:
In confluence 4.0 and also with 4.0.3 there is stability problems after runing a user search request. In the Confluence Administration area, when running a search 'All users', the system hangs (does not produce the report). The rest of confluence will still work for some time, but after several hours the instance usually stops responding completely, and confluence needs to be restarted.

A suspected cause for this is usernames with spaces in them that were bulk imported from another system. For example a username would be "john doe".

There is a separate bug to be filed regarding issues with spaces in usernames (when a user with a space in their username tries to reset their password, they get into a loop where the can't do so because it's only recognizing the first part of their username before the space).
fields.summary: confluence instance hanging with user queries - possibly due to spaces in usernames
toc macro's maxlevel wrong after 4.0 Upgrade

fields.description:
To reproduce:
# Start out with an unordered list where the first bullet is indented and there are varying levels of indentation below it.
# select the entire list
# outdent the list
# notice that some of the bullets become removed - it's also difficult to edit the list after that.

The editor seems to be adding arbitrary <li> styles...list-style=none.

h3. Intended behaviour specification

If you have: 

- first
-- second
--- third

Selecting "second" and "third" and then unindenting will result in: 

- first
- second
-- third

That is, if it is possible to unindent all bullet items in the selection by one level, then do so. However, if one bullet item is already at the base level, do nothing. 

That is:

- first
-- second 
--- third

If all three items are selected, unindenting should not result in any changes.
fields.summary: Unindenting Nested Indented Lists breaks the list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24122].
  {panel}

Confluence can appear to be over eager to hyperlink things it things are URL's when pasting them in. 

eg: if you paste ldap:///CN=<CATruncatedName><CRLNameSuffix>,CN=DC1,CN=CDP,CN=Public Key Services,CN=Services,<ConfigurationContainer>

then the ldap:///CN= section will become a hyperlink. 

Should we consider a list of specific protocols we will auto hyperlink only.
fields.summary: Review auto-linking behaviour

fields.description:
User reported two problems involving coloured text and lists.

I was unable to reproduce the errors he described in OSX/Chrome but did see some strangeness with coloured text. If you colour individual pieces of text then select everything on the page and change it to black sometimes it would do nothing until the second attempt. Sometimes it would jump to only selecting part of the text and changing it, sometimes it would work.

When pasting into another page then trying to change the colour I did not get any content loss but did see the text turn a blue colour before a second attempt and making it black succeeded.

I took several screencasts of attempts to reproduce the users bugs and caught the above:

Pasting all green text to another page : http://screencast.com/t/s9Gz8hBo
Unsuccessfully turning partially green text to black on whole page : http://screencast.com/t/1Oa07notMS
fields.summary: Problems with coloured text

As per this video, done in OSX using Chrome 15, replacing a misspelled word with the one suggested by Chrome moves that word from one table cell to another.

http://screencast.com/t/8sr7xGcKEa
fields.summary: Replacing misspelled word in a table moves it to the next cell

fields.description:
The _delete_ key sometimes does funny things when it is used in conjunction with superscripts. The editor seems to recognize when the cursor is "inside" or "outside" the character style, but this sometimes leads to the _delete_ key not functioning correctly.

1- Add a new page in the editor.
2- Enable superscript mode using the dropdown.
3- Type "a".
4- Disable superscript mode using the dropdown.
5- Type "sdf".

The state of the editor should now be as shown in ss_1.png.

6- Press the _left arrow_ key three times to put the cursor in front of the "s". Press _enter_.
7- The "sdf" jumps down to the next line as expected.
8- Press _delete_ (or _backspace_ on a PC) to bring the "sdf" back to the previous line.
9- Press the _left arrow_ key once.
10- Press the _right arrow_ key once. The cursor is now to the right of the "a".
11- Press the _enter_ key and watch the "sdf" jump down to the next line.
12- Press the _delete_ key...and nothing happens. The expected result is the same as what happened in step 8, which is that "sdf" should be joined with the previous line again. One needs to press _delete_ a second time in order to see the expected result.
fields.summary: Cursor key movements can prevent immediate deletion when used with superscript and other character styles

fields.description:
The RTE produces surprising results when using the delete key at the beginning of a line, when applied to a line that already has formatting.

For example, create a new page and enter the following:

{code}
Line 1.



h3. Line 3.

Line 4.
{code}

Note that line 2 is blank and contains no text. (Just press enter.) The editor should appear as shown in ss1.png.

Next, click with the pointer at the beginning of line 3. Then press <delete> (or <backspace> if you're on a PC). The results are as shown in ss2.png.

The problem is that Confluence is deleting the style applied to line 3 when the <delete> key is pressed. This behavior would make complete sense if line 2 had any content (since the text "Line 3" would end up being joined with line 2 text in what is effectively a paragraph style). However, the behavior is not intuitive when line 2 is a blank line.

In this case, it seems clear to me that the user's intent is to delete the blank line above where the cursor lives, without changing any styles.

(For what it's worth, I see that Microsoft Word also works the way I described when used with paragraph styles.)

Update:

In addition to the above, the results are also borked using a different sequence of operations, even without a blank line being involved. Follow these steps to reproduce (also with Conf 4.0.5 and FF 8.0.1 on OS X):

- Create a new page.
- Type "Foo bar. This is a test."
- Press enter
- Type "This is more stuff."
- Click "Heading 3" in the style dropdown
- Use the pointer to place the cursor immediately before the word "This" on the first line.
- Press enter to move the text "This is a test." down to the next line.
- Press <shift-down> to highlight the entire line "This is a test."
- Press <delete> to delete the line "This is a test."
- Note that the Heading 3 style applied to the "This is more stuff." line has disappeared.
fields.summary: Deleting a line from editor unexpectedly removes formatting

fields.description:
It looks broken in the editor, but you preview or save the page it's actually fine.

This is on Chrome (17)
fields.summary: Applying text formatting to a table row shifts the row to the right by once cell

fields.description:
When attempting to assign individual users (but not self) for restrictions to a page, an error is produced preventing the page from being created.

Steps to reproduce
- Add page
- Alter restrictions to include one or more individually specified users, (but not "me") 
- Attempt to save the page
- Note the exception stack produced (see attachment for web page presented)

This appears to also be broken when editing an existing page, but does not produce a user visible error message, the ajax request simply never closes the restrictions dialog box.
fields.summary: Attempting to add individual users for page restrictions produces an error

fields.description:
h3. Summary of The Bug

This bug is kind of a regression of this [bug|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-23289]. Seems that the previous bug does not totally fix the bug as users could still reproduce the issue when the table is created under a macro such as {{{expand}}} or {{{excerpt}} macro

h3. How to Reproduce

# Create an expand macro on Confluence 4.0 editor
# Inside the macro create a table
# Put random content on the first row
# Copy the previously created content to another cell

Refer to this [video|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/56093/2011-12-09_1046.swf] for the detail
fields.summary: Table Copy / Paste in Safari 5 always copies cell information instead of content when the table is created inside a macro

fields.description:
SQL Server user and Oracle users tend to use {{schema-name}} attribute in datasource definition or the following attribute in confluence.cfg.xml:
{code}
<property name="hibernate.default_schema">dbo</property>
{code}

This works flawlessly in Confluence. However, there seems to be some hardcoded SQL queries in some of the upgrade tasks which causes the schema attribute to be completely ignored, hence failing the upgrade.

One of them that I found is {{EmbeddedCrowdSchemaUpgradeTask.java}} which failed an upgrade of Confluence 3.1 to 3.5.13 with the following stacktrace in the log:
{code}2011-12-09 17:31:44,028 ERROR [main] [atlassian.confluence.upgrade.UpgradeLauncherServletContextListener] contextInitialized Upgrade failed, application will not start: Upgrade task com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.upgradetask.EmbeddedCrowdSchemaUpgradeTask@63af5853 failed during the SCHEMA_UPGRADE phase due to: StatementCallback; bad SQL grammar [SELECT mem1.id, mem1.parent_id, mem1.child_group_id, mem1.child_user_id FROM cwd_membership mem1, cwd_membership mem2 WHERE mem1.id <> mem2.id AND mem1.parent_id = mem2.parent_id AND mem1.child_user_id = mem2.child_user_id ORDER BY mem1.parent_id ASC, mem1.child_user_id ASC, mem1.id ASC]; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: Invalid object name 'cwd_membership'.
com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.UpgradeException: Upgrade task com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.upgradetask.EmbeddedCrowdSchemaUpgradeTask@63af5853 failed during the SCHEMA_UPGRADE phase due to: StatementCallback; bad SQL grammar [SELECT mem1.id, mem1.parent_id, mem1.child_group_id, mem1.child_user_id FROM cwd_membership mem1, cwd_membership mem2 WHERE mem1.id <> mem2.id AND mem1.parent_id = mem2.parent_id AND mem1.child_user_id = mem2.child_user_id ORDER BY mem1.parent_id ASC, mem1.child_user_id ASC, mem1.id ASC]; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: Invalid object name 'cwd_membership'.
	at com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager.executeUpgradeStep(AbstractUpgradeManager.java:216)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager.runSchemaUpgradeTasks(AbstractUpgradeManager.java:135)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager.upgrade(AbstractUpgradeManager.java:92)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.impl.DefaultUpgradeManager.upgrade(DefaultUpgradeManager.java:140)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.UpgradeLauncherServletContextListener.contextInitialized(UpgradeLauncherServletContextListener.java:28)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.listenerStart(StandardContext.java:4205)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.start(StandardContext.java:4704)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.start(ContainerBase.java:1053)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHost.start(StandardHost.java:840)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.start(ContainerBase.java:1053)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardEngine.start(StandardEngine.java:463)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardService.start(StandardService.java:525)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardServer.start(StandardServer.java:754)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina.start(Catalina.java:595)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap.start(Bootstrap.java:289)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap.main(Bootstrap.java:414)
Caused by: org.springframework.jdbc.BadSqlGrammarException: StatementCallback; bad SQL grammar [SELECT mem1.id, mem1.parent_id, mem1.child_group_id, mem1.child_user_id FROM cwd_membership mem1, cwd_membership mem2 WHERE mem1.id <> mem2.id AND mem1.parent_id = mem2.parent_id AND mem1.child_user_id = mem2.child_user_id ORDER BY mem1.parent_id ASC, mem1.child_user_id ASC, mem1.id ASC]; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: Invalid object name 'cwd_membership'.
	at org.springframework.jdbc.support.SQLErrorCodeSQLExceptionTranslator.translate(SQLErrorCodeSQLExceptionTranslator.java:230)
	at org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate.execute(JdbcTemplate.java:354)
	at org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate.query(JdbcTemplate.java:405)
	at org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate.query(JdbcTemplate.java:409)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.upgradetask.EmbeddedCrowdSchemaUpgradeTask.removeDuplicateUserMemberships(EmbeddedCrowdSchemaUpgradeTask.java:106)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.upgradetask.EmbeddedCrowdSchemaUpgradeTask.doBeforeUpgrade(EmbeddedCrowdSchemaUpgradeTask.java:66)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.upgradetask.AbstractConstraintCreationUpgradeTask.doUpgrade(AbstractConstraintCreationUpgradeTask.java:119)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:304)
	at EmbeddedCrowdSchemaUpgradeTask.javaorg.springframework.aop.framework.Rorg.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:182)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:149)

fields.description:
user is having an issue trying to edit a page with a lot of content.

View, resume or discard change does not work, not even for admins. When going to the page it lists the last change as the day before, but when going into edit it it says that I have a previously unsaved version from today, and if I try to discard or even resume editing it i get page not found error.

Our developers have done testing and they have confirmed that the problem exists when the page code has the character string " " and more than 1183 lines of code.
fields.summary: Editing page shows previous copy and view, resume or discard change does not work

fields.description:
h3. Summary of The Bug

Anchor macro broke 4.0 editor when users try to edit the anchor inside the lowest cell and save their modification by pressing "Enter" on Safari browser. This would result to broken editor as in "Preview", "Save" and "cancel" button is not working.

h3. How to reproduce

# Access Confluence using Safari browser
# Create a new page
# Create a 2x2 table
# Add an anchor on the first row
!1stanchor.png|thumbnail!
# Create a new anchor, and save it using enter button
# Anchor is not saved and editor is freeze
!freeze.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Anchor macro broke editor when users use "Enter" button to save the macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24102].
  {panel}

Webkit only. 

When I type \*foo\* in the editor and it autoformats I expect: 
- foo to be bolded
- the cursor to be blinking just after the word foo
- the "styling" or "formatting" at the cursor to be *not* bold. That is, if I continue typing, it should be plain styled text not more bold text.
fields.summary: Typing *foo* autoformats and leaves the formatting as bold at the cursor

fields.description:
To reproduce, create a new page and select Insert->Wiki Markup.

Then copy and paste the following text, and insert it into the page:

{code}
* foo
* bar
** broz
** baz
*** top
** bottom
* middle
{code}

Now, after the content has been rendered, click the pointer in front of the word "baz" (see "before.png") and then click the delete key (see "after.png").

Note that "baz" has jumped up one line but the bullet below remains where it is. It is also no longer possible to select the bulleted line below the "baz".

Safari 5.1.2 on OS X 10.7.2.
fields.summary: Trying to delete bullets from editor results in unselectable hanging bullet

fields.description:
When we cross out paragraphs or sentences in the text editor, often they are not crossed out, instead, a single "-" appears in front and after the sentences. It is annoying when we try to edit larger documents together.

Replicate:
- create page
- enter text in a few paragraphs
- mark some of the text
- choose the "cross out function"
- save
- text is not being crossed out entirely, I think especially if "-"s are involved in the text but not always. see attached picture
fields.summary: crossing out of text does not work

fields.description:
The RTE is still badly broken when it comes to operating on content inside nested block macros with Safari. In these scenarios, cut and paste produces bizarre and nearly-impossible-to-fix results. We have a lot of content inside section macros, and editing is really painful.

As an example, install v1.7.0 of the Adaptavist Content Formatting macros. (Yes, they're marked as compatible with Conf 3.5.x, but the rendering of the macros in the plugin works fine--it's the editor that is broken! It also breaks using, for example, the {info} macro.)

In the editor, create a new page and then

- type "{section"
- click the "Section" macro
- type "{column"
- click the "Column" macro
- type "This is a test."

At this point, the screen should look as shown in step1.png.

- use your mouse to select the recently-entered text "is"
- press command-X to cut
- press command-V to paste

The system then duplicates the entire set of section and column macros, as shown in step2.png.

The end result is that it's practically impossible to move any content around inside a block macro. The only workaround I've found is to cut the text out of Confluence, paste it into an external app (like TextEdit), and then hit command-C in the external app (which seems to remove any embedded markup) and then paste it back into the editor...it works, but it's a big time sink.

Tested using Safari 5.1.2 on OS X 10.7.2.
fields.summary: Safari 5 support broken in new editor: cut and paste inside macro blocks is unusable

fields.description:
Under certain circumstances the cursor is not visible to the user on the screen, although it would seem that it is in fact active inside the editor because pressing a key (eg: delete) acts on the content.

Examples given by user from Editor Feedback page:

*Example 1*
* Start with the Welcome to the Confluence Demonstration Space page and edit it.
* Click inside the Column macro, in the white space, above the first image, over the left end of the image.
What is selected? There is no insertion point. A macro edit popup appears at the bottom of the screen
* Press Backspace - what is deleted?
* A space in front of the first image is deleted and an insertion point now appears in front of the first image. If this is correct then shouldn't an insertion point appeared before the image when the click happened?

*Example 2*
* Start with the Welcome to the Confluence Demonstration Space page and edit it.
* Click inside the Column macro, in the white space, above the first image, over the right end of the image.
What is selected? There is no insertion point. A macro edit popup appears at the bottom of the screen
* Press Backspace - what is deleted?
* The first image is deleted. If this is correct then shouldn't an insertion point have appeared after the image when the click happened?

*Example 3*
* Start with the Welcome to the Confluence Demonstration Space page and edit it.
* Click and drag from inside the Column macro, in the white space, tight in the left top corner of the macro, down and to the right bottom to select the macros contents.
* Everything is selected as was hoped.
* Do the same thing, but this time start the click and drag in the white space above the first image.
* The first image is not selected?
fields.summary: Cursor not visible in editor - Firefox 8 on Windows only
Unbolding text causes the page to slowly creep down

fields.description:
This happens whenever you try to escape out of a list item when it contains a macro body placeholder.

Try the following:

# Create a bullet item with some text
# Hit shift+enter
# Insert a code macro using autocomplete
# Hit cursor-down to get just below the code macro
# Hit enter

Expected outcome would be a new bullet item, but instead I only get a new line.
fields.summary: Can't escape out of a list item containing a macro body placeholder

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

When using Confluence 4.0.5, daily email notifications regarding changes done in the last 24 hours are empty.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Set up a mail server with Confluence 4.0.5
# Subscribe to daily updates
# Do some changes, and wait for the daily email update (or run the job instantly from the Scheduled Jobs menu)
# Check your mail inbox and see if the daily update mail have any contents

h3. Findings

* This was tested using gmail.com as a mail server (using JNDI connection), and sending to ymail.com
* During first testing, the daily notifications work properly (there are contents in the mail). During next testing (done a few days later), the daily notifications are empty even though changes have been made.
fields.summary: Daily email notifications sends empty mails
The code macro remove the line break characters while parsing text via IE
Documentation Theme slidebar appears over previewed image
Add the more icon at the bottom of the recently updated gadget on the dashboard
Searching for link target URLs (href attribute)
Permissions check/warning when adding page restrictions

fields.description:
Confluence 4.1+ permits the user to use many new special characters in page names that were not previously permitted.

Unfortunately, these characters break the WebDAV server in 4.1-rc1. When I create a page in Confluence with title:

{code}
Great Stuff for C:\!
{code}

...then WebDAV clients are unable to access it.

For example, attempting to click on the above-named folder with XP results in the following error message and no content in the folder:

"Documents in this folder are not available. They may have been moved or deleted, or network problems may be preventing a connection to the server."

Attempting to connect from OS X 10.7 to the same page shows an empty folder.

If I append a forward slash to the above page title, then the containing folder disappears entirely from view of both XP and OS X and I am unable to see it in any form.

Any special characters should be properly escaped by the WebDAV server so that legal directory names are passed to the client.
fields.summary: Page names with special characters break WebDAV clients
Copy and paste text from Confluence will include the link to the confluence page
Auto upgrade produces invalid setenv.sh if JAVA_OPTS spans multiple lines

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24073].
  {panel}

Comalatech's Ad-Hoc workflow plugin still leaves a lot to be desired in a edit/approve/publish workflow cycle. For technical documents like ISO9001 controlled documents and all kinds og specification documents, it is absolutely essential that the documents are alive while only the published version is available to everyone. The Comalatech plugin accomplishes this to a certain degree.

Points of improvement over what's currently available:
-Ideally, only the *published* versions should be visible in the version history
- the space owner should have the possibility to escalate other users' privileges up to his own to allow editing specific documents on request - i.e. the reverse of the current "restrict" privilege
- some kind of attribute should follow the controlled page enforcing the publish privilege
- approvals must be logged with which users approved the document, essential for the electronic paper trail
fields.summary: Native support for contribute/publish workflow
Testing Word document

Here is the reproduction procedure:
# Add the bullet list or numbered list.

We can observe that the text editor is not available any more and no text typing is accepted. Also, we can find the error message in the atlassian-confluence.log, if we use the "right arrow" in the test:

2011-12-05 19:00:29,689 INFO [http-4405-2] [render.xhtml.migration.ErrorReportingV2Renderer] render Unable to render content on page ~admin:copy parse test
Wrapping content in unmigrated wiki markup macro due to system error: The macro 'right arrow' is unknown.
{noformat}

fields.description:
When saving a page, Confluence removes all spaces which had been deliberately inserted between formatted and unformatted text.

The end result is concatenated text that looks unprofessional. (See the attached image.)

I've noticed that this only seems to happen in numbered or bulleted list blocks.

-If this bug is not reproducible (i.e. with newly added content), please also consider if this issue might be an upgrade artifact (i.e. introduced into existing content) as a result of upgrading from Confluence 3.5 (or earlier) to Confluence 4.0.-
fields.summary: When saving a page, Confluence removes all spaces which had been deliberately inserted between formatted and unformatted text.

fields.description:
The {jira-issues} macro will fail to return results if the temporary JIRA query URL contains an encoded ampersand (%26).

Example URL: http://tde/jira/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?jqlQuery=project%3D%22ALM+Architecture%22+and+component%3D%22Dashboards+%26+Visual+Controls%22&tempMax=1000

!jira_issues.jpg!

Steps to reproduce:

1) JIRA: associate several issues with a component that contains an ampersand, like: "My Component & Stuff"
2) JIRA: click Issues->Search for Issues
3) JIRA: enter a query like the following: project="My Project" and component="My Component & Stuff"
4) JIRA: click "search"
5) JIRA: click View->XML
6) JIRA: copy the URL from the browser
7) Confluence: insert a { jira-issues } macro into a page
8) Confluence: use the URL from step 6
9) Confluence: preview the macro
10) Confluence: Observer the error: "The JIRA server was not able to process the search..."

If the URL contains an encoded ampersand (%26) then the macro fails to render the results. This URL was copied from the browser's URL field when viewing the results in XML format.
fields.summary: jira-issues Macro Fails When URL Contains an Encoded Ampersand
Navigation tree throws an error on new page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24054].
  {panel}

Hey, not really sure how to word the title properly, please do edit the title to make it more obvious. 

Basically the problem is this, since there are no longer Wiki Markup in Confluence 4, users are not able to copy the markup of content in a page to be kept in a text file or html file. The workaround is this:

# Go to the page that you wish to export, and click "Edit"
# On Chrome, press F12 to bring up the developer Console. (same shortcut key on Firefox as well, only if Firebug is installed as addon)
# Click on Console
# Run this command in the Console:
{code}
tinyMCE.activeEditor.getContent()
{code}
# Copy all of the XHTML content generated by the command
# Paste it in a text file, and save it as a .html file. 
To import,
# Open the .html file in a browser.
# Copy all contents shown in the browser (Ctrl+A, then Ctrl+C)
# Create a new page in Confluence
# Paste the contents into the page.

It would be nice to at least, auto generate these HTML files with a click of a button, for non tech savvy users.
fields.summary: Provide an easier way to save page formatting in a text/html file

fields.description:
TOC Macro does not work for Japanese headings ....


he TOC macro does not work correctly for Japanese headings in Confluence 4.0.3.

For example,

{toc}

h1. 山田
text 
text
text 
text
text
h1. 島田
text 
text
text 
text
text
h1. 熊田
text 
text
text 
text
text

{toc}

creates following table of content.

    山田
    島田
    熊田

However, clicking any of the link always points to the first heading. 

The actor point always becomes '~'
fields.summary: TOC Macro does not work for Japanese headings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24049].
  {panel}

h5. Steps to reproduce
# Paste a block of text that involves more than one paragraph into a body macro
e.g.
{noformat}
Please award me the world's best dog petter award

I am really good at petting dogs
{noformat}
# Highlight the text and attempt to delete or cut the text - the text will stay put.

This can be reproduced consistently on the first time a page is created - however, if the defect is attempted to be reproduced subsequent times the defect may not appear.
Alternate behaviours include:
* the highlighted text is deleted as normal, leaving the macroplaceholder
* the macro placeholder is deleted with the highlighted text



h5. Reproduced on
h6. Environment
4.0 CAC
4.1 OD GAPPS
h6. Browsers
IE8

(no repro)
Chrome
